{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.19945v1", "title": "Hyperkaehler Marriage of the two sphere with the hyperbolic space", "summary": "The Eguchi-Hanson metric is a natural metric on the total space of the
cotangent bundle $T^*\mathbb{CP}(1)$ of the complex projective line
$\mathbb{CP}(1) \simeq \mathbb{S}^2$, which extends the Fubini-Study metric of
$\mathbb{CP}(1)$. By virtue of the Mostow decomposition theorem,
$T^*\mathbb{CP}(1)$ is isomorphic, as $SU(2)$-equivariant fiber bundle over
$\mathbb{CP}(1)$, to a complex (co-)adjoint orbit of $SL(2, \mathbb{C})$. In
fact, this complex (co-)adjoint orbit is fibered over $\mathbb{CP}(1)\simeq
\mathbb{S}^2$ with each fiber isomorphic to the hyperbolic disc $\mathbb{H}^2$.
In this paper, we are interested in the complex structure inherited on the
hyperbolic disc $\mathbb{H}^2$ by the hyperk\"ahler extension of the
$2$-sphere. Contrary to what is generally believed, we show that it differs
from the natural complex structure of $\mathbb{H}^2\subset \mathbb{C}$
inherited from its embedding in $\mathbb{C}$. In other words, the embedding of
$\mathbb{H}^2$ with its Hermitian-symmetric structure into the hyperk\"ahler
manifold $T^*\mathbb{CP}(1)$ is not holomorphic.", "main_category": "math.DG", "categories": "math.DG,math.CV,math.SG", "published": "2025-04-28T16:18:08Z"}
